intro: Garayanthus inflatus, commonly known as the inflated bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive inflated, bell-shaped flowers that can range in color from white to pink. Native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and specialized horticulture.
